column1:
2355|Eleven fifty-five|The band began playing “Auld Lang Syne.”
“Eleven fifty-five
column3: glancing at the gold watch on her pendant. “I really like ‘Auld Lang Syne.’ How about you?”

column1: 2355|five minutes to midnight|As Ness arrives at Union Station
column2: the giant clock tells us it is five minutes to midnight. This is significant
column3: because humans consider midnight a time when bad things happen. Midnight is the Ides of March of the hours in the day! "Five minutes to midnight" is therefore excellent foreshadowing. After all
column4: it is almost directly equivalent to "Five minutes to very bad things happening".

column1: 2355|five minutes to midnight|I am going to lock you in. It is- he consulted his watch
column3: three turns should do it. Good luck."

column1: 2355|five minutes to twelve|It wanted five minutes to twelve
column2: when the premonitory symptoms of the working of the laudanum first showed themselves to me. At this time
column3: no unpractised eyes would have detected any change in him. But
column4: as the minutes of the new morning wore away
column5: the swiftly-subtle progress of the influence began to show itself more plainly. The sublime intoxication of opium gleamed in his eyes; the dew of a stealthy perspiration began to glisten on his face. In five minutes more
column6: the talk which he still kept up with me
